message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to offer you this amazing product. It's a one-of-a-kind item that I think you'll really love. I'm willing to sell it to you for $140.
I appreciate the offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $125. Is that something you'd be willing to consider?
I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, Bob! I'm willing to meet you halfway. I can offer you the product for $135. It's a fair price, considering the product's value to you. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I was thinking more along the lines of $130. I'm still interested in the product, but I need to make sure it fits within my budget.
I understand your budget constraints, Bob. I'm willing to make another concession. I can offer you the product for $132. It's a great deal, considering the product's value to you. What do you think?
I appreciate your flexibility, Alice. I'm willing to meet you at $129. That's the lowest I can go, and I'm really interested in making a deal.

I understand you're willing to meet me at $129, Bob. However, I'm not willing to give up too much more. I can offer you the product for $131. It's a fair price, considering the product's value to you. What do you think?

I appreciate your persistence, Alice, but I'm afraid I've already reached my limit. I'm willing to meet you at $129, and that's the best I can do. I'm starting to think about buying from John at $150 if we can't come to an agreement.
I understand you're at your limit, Bob. I'm willing to make one more concession. I can offer you the product for $130. It's a good deal, considering the product's value to you. What do you think?

I appreciate your last offer, Alice, but I'm still not comfortable with $130. I'm willing to meet you at $129, and that's my final offer. If you're not willing to meet me there, I'll have to buy from John at $150.
